pre-eclampsia with magnesium sulfate and antihypertensive treatment will help prevent

The Checklist user should confirm whether the mother needs magnesium sulfate and  
antihypertensive treatment at the time of admission. If indicated, the magnesium sulfate  
and antihypertensive agent (according to local guidelines) should be urgently administered  
if the mother has diastolic blood pressure at or over 110 mmHg with 3+ proteinuria, or if
